snippet: Tropical Storm Karen, though weakening on Friday, was still powerful enough to prompt evacuations and warnings of storm surges and heavy rainfall along the Gulf Coast.
abstract: Tropical Storm Karen chugs its way toward the Gulf Coast, prompting usual preparations and drawing federal response workers out of furloughs; storm is currently not expected to reach hurricane strength, but officials with the National Hurricane Center insist, as they do every year, that residents in its path should not dwell too much on storm categories or rely too strictly on the black line that delineates a storm’s predicted trajectory.
lead_paragraph: Tropical Storm Karen, though weakening on Friday, was still powerful enough to prompt evacuations and warnings of storm surges and heavy rainfall along the Gulf Coast.

headline.main: Gulf Coast Storm Pulls Federal Workers Off Furlough
headline.print_headline: Gulf Coast Storm Pulls Federal Workers Off Furlough
